intro: Spermacoce petraea, commonly known as rock senna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, black seeds. Spermacoce petraea thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
